title: Pause Menu
body:
As a player I want to be able to pause/save my game so that I can choose when I want to start and stop my gaming session.
This menu should also include a settings menu where I can customize my experience to my liking.

title: Day Night Cycle
body:
As a developer I want to provide my players with a dynamic environment so that they feel immersed in their environment.
This can be done through an everchanging sky cycling between day and night.

title: Build Settings
body:
As a developer I want the process of building my application to be as seamless as possible so that the developers
can work as efficiently as possible. This may include things like: application icon, testing different resolutions, special settings
for targeting certain platforms, etc.

title: Tightrope/Slackline
body:
As a player I want there to be challenging and unique movement mechanics so that I can enjoy controlling my character
and overcoming various challenges. More specifically, overcoming large gaps will be completed through "Slacklines". 
Slacklines is a mechanic that entails balancing your character over long distances.

title: Level Design (Phase 3)
body:
As a player of a 3D puzzle platformer, I want there will be some sort of level that I can traverse, so that I can overcome 
various challenges and reach a goal state. This story expands on "Level Design (Phase 2)". It is intended to be the "Final Pass"
over the game levels. This includes but not limited to: ensuring player boundaries are setup properly, ensuring that the design
look and feel of the level is detailed, etc.

title: Level Design (Phase 2)
body:
As a player of a 3D puzzle platformer, I want there will be some sort of level that I can traverse, so that I can overcome 
various challenges and reach a goal state. This story expands on "Basic Level Design". It is intended to be a "Second Pass" 
over the levels that have been built. This includes but not limited to: ensuring that the gameplay is challenging and fun, the level design
fits the theme of the game, etc.

title: Level Decoration
body:
As a player the world must be detailed in various ways so that I can enjoy the game and feel immersed. This can be achieved
by designing the levels with attention to detail in mind.

title: Background Music
body:
As a player I would like to feel various emotions from the game so that my experience can be enhanced. One form of 
accomplishing this is to implement good music to accompany gameplay.

title: Interactive Sounds
body:
As a player I would like to hear sounds when important events take place so that I can further immerse myself in the game world while simultaneously providing direct feedback. 

In other words, sounds should play when "things" happen such as: opening a door, jumping and landing, walking, etc.

title: Ambient Sounds
body: As a player I would like there to be various ambient noises that relate to the environment around me so that I can feel immersed in the world.

title: Highlighted Interactable Objects
body:
As a player I want interactable objects to be highlighted so that I can tell what objects I can interact with in the world.

This will be shown by an outline, or slight emissive glow on items that can be used.

title: Interactable Object Text Display
body:
As a player I want text to display on the screen when looking at an interactable object.

Text will help give players context about how the item/object is used.

title: Breakable Items
body:
As I player I want to be given clues to search for "key items" to aid in my progression in the game.

These key items should be hidden in various "breakable objects" that will reveal a key item when broken. There should also be sound and animations when breaking an item.

title: Openable/Interactive Doors
body:
As a player I want there to be various "obstacles" placed around the map to denote that there is a task that needs to be solved before progressing. These obstacles will take the form of doors.

Doors should be interactable to the player and have various opening and closing sounds/animations when used depending on the mesh.

title: Bird Environmental Feature
body:
As a creative director, I want to be able to obtain some dynamic visual moments so that I can create an eye catching trailer to help sell this game.

One way to do this is to create additional environmental features which may not contribute to gameplay, but make the game world seem more fleshed out/interactive.

Since this game involves traversing an urban environment, it would make sense to populate the world with birds/other creatures which will react to the actions of the player. Giving the option for the player to chase after a flock of birds would be a nice visual moment that would both immerse the player and add some variety to a sizzle reel.

title: Climb up walls - Advanced
body:
Follow-up to #7 

As a level designer, I want to be able to enforce limits on which surfaces the player can climb so that I can have more control over how the player can solve my puzzles and challenges.

Without limits, extensive care would need to be placed on level geometry so that the player could not simply bypass any obstacle greatly increasing the complexity of these areas and opening us up to numerous exploits.

We could use the climbing mechanic in combination with #4 to provide some limits on what the user can climb over/how much their momentum carries over to their vertical movement.

title: Basic Level Design
body:
As a player of a 3D puzzle platformer, I want there will be some sort of level that I can traverse, so that I can overcome various challenges and reach a goal state.

This level does not need to be pretty to look at, but should have some semblance of a theme, and some obstacles for me to overcome.
